result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaytaiz Jawon Lashawn Polk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA Sample and pay applicable surcharge. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

No contact with with the victim, Vernetta R., unless approved by the agent. 
No contact with Terry C., or Lamonte M.
Court grants expunction if no further actions rise to the level of probable cause, there are no further arrests, and all fines are paid in full.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jaytaiz Jawon Lashawn Polk in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Jaytaiz Jawon Lashawn Polk in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, straight time. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No contact with with the victim, Vernetta R., unless approved by the agent. 
-AODA assessment
-Absolute Sobriety
-Mental Health assessment
-Anger Management classes
-No contact with Terry C., or Lamonte M.
-Provide DNA Sample and pay applicable surcharge. 
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

*Court grants expunction if no further actions rise to the level of probable cause, there are no further arrests, and all fines are paid in full. 

Filed, Right of Notice of Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Jaytaiz Jawon Lashawn Polk in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Jaytaiz Jawon Lashawn Polk in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appearing under the Student Practice Rules as supervised by Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 1 Dismissed, and Read In.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Jaytaiz Jawon Lashawn Polk not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defense counsel is newly appointed and has not yet received discovery from prior counsel and requests an adjourned plea/sentencing date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jaytaiz Jawon Lashawn Polk NOT in court, in custody with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing at defense request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Jaytaiz Jawon Lashawn Polk not in court, in custody.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, court waived defendant's appearance.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense counsel requests a status conference date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VERNETTA R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jaytaiz Jawon Lashawn Polk in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Jaytaiz Jawon Lashawn Polk in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
